text:
[2025/04/30 12:00:00 GMT+0000]
[00:16:15] Participant 33: Okay, that's okay, so that's longer… Let's… "Old Scratch owner's death ruled an accident, a tragic end to a difficult year. The Perdition's Sheriff's Office announced Monday that it has ruled the death of Old Scratch Tavern owner, Nicholas Webster, an accident. According to Sheriff Paul McGinty, Webster fell to his death in the early hours of Saturday morning, likely minutes after leaving Old Scratch Tavern. "It was dark and unfortunately Nick just lost his footing," McGinty [00:17:00] said at a press conference Monday morning."
 "A neighbour discovered Webster's remains at the bottom of Devil's Well, a local waterfall, early Saturday morning." So, we have not seen all this, right? 
[00:17:22] Participant 32: No, not yet, we're just…this is the newspaper article. 
[00:17:25] Participant 33: We have seen that, letter from Carmen, newspaper article, we are on the second one. "This is not the first misfortune to befall Webster and his tavern in recent months. In July, Webster told this paper nothing valuable was stolen following the series of petty burglaries but said he was taking measures to ensure that incidents did not continue. Sheriff McGinty confirmed that no perpetrators were apprehended for the thefts."
 "More recently, Webster had reported a series of small fires and other disturbance at [00:18:00] the bar. Official records show that Webster called Perdition Emergency…"
[00:18:13] Participant 31: Can you see…? 
[00:18:14] Participant 32: Oh, I can hear, it's okay. 
[00:18:15] Participant 33: "…services ten times between…" Should I speak louder? 
[00:18:20] Participant 32: It's okay, I can hear.
